name: Quran (Read in 90+ Languages)

alignment.comment: Directly advances access to the Qur'an across many languages; strong educational/public benefit.

openness.comment: No LICENSE file in this repo. Add an explicit open-source license (MIT/BSD/Unlicense) to remove ambiguity.

liveness.comment: History shows ~164 commits with open issues; no releases; activity appears intermittent. A light maintenance cadence would help.

value.comment: Simple, fast reader powered by a separate API; practical for learners though technically modest.

docs.comment: README includes usage links and edition parameters; add local setup, build, and explicit accessibility/RTL guidance.

community.comment: Few contributors and limited governance materials; add CONTRIBUTING, CODE_OF_CONDUCT, and issue/PR templates.

summary: A straightforward Qur'an reader spanning many languages via an external Quran API. With an explicit license, contributor docs, and a small release cadence, it could move closer to Model status.
narrative: The project offers a simple, shareable way to read the Qur'an and jump to chapters/verses or specify editions via URL parameters, which makes it learner-friendly and easy to embed in lessons.
Its reliance on a separate Free Quran API keeps this repo lightweight; clarifying attribution and licensing would improve reuse and institutional adoption.
Introducing basic governance files and a predictable update rhythm would encourage outside contributions and signal ongoing stewardship.
recommendations: Add a LICENSE file (MIT/BSD/Unlicense) and include brief attribution to the Quran API and edition sources.
Add CONTRIBUTING.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, and issue/PR templates (bug, new edition request, feature).
Tag periodic releases and keep a short CHANGELOG.
Expand documentation with local setup/build and an accessibility checklist (keyboard, contrast, screen reader, RTL).
